alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 10:52PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Susquehanna, eastern Bradford and northwestern Wyoming Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1051 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lincoln Falls, or 15 miles southeast of Canton, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rush, Towanda, West Franklin, Wysox, Springville, Sheshequin, Ulster, Wilmot, Hollenback and Orwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
